messages: b28f268a6e12f0f630263c565e1f64ed (03:08): nemith: ever heard of/used ms internet security application server or some shit like that?
5413d900581bd6546043f95aae132a3f (03:08): heard of and used it very little
b28f268a6e12f0f630263c565e1f64ed (03:09): is it worth a shit?
5413d900581bd6546043f95aae132a3f (03:09): it's acutally not that bad
5413d900581bd6546043f95aae132a3f (03:09): it's a proxy, firewall, vpn terminator, and radius server
5413d900581bd6546043f95aae132a3f (03:10): i've seen a lot of people use it just for the radius server
b28f268a6e12f0f630263c565e1f64ed (03:10): sounds pretty cool.
b28f268a6e12f0f630263c565e1f64ed (03:10): hrm. w/ the radius I could do dot1x.
5413d900581bd6546043f95aae132a3f (03:11): the reason why radius is popular on it is that it is already tied to ad
b28f268a6e12f0f630263c565e1f64ed (03:11): yeah, that's why I was considering dot1x. everything tied together.
b28f268a6e12f0f630263c565e1f64ed (03:12): yeah ACS seems cool as well. we use tac_plus instead though. cheap bastards.
b28f268a6e12f0f630263c565e1f64ed (03:14): we don't have it (yet?)... I'm going to a class on it monday. next month is pix class
5413d900581bd6546043f95aae132a3f (03:14): 1499 per proc for standard.  5,999 for enterprise
b28f268a6e12f0f630263c565e1f64ed (03:21): sort of a wash at that level.
8f9327ec6dbef67f00539896dd59f167 (03:23): If I am upgrading/downgrading a ciso 3750's IOS, stack wise with 2 switch members, do I have to load th new IOS onto both 3750's sepratly or will one do?
b28f268a6e12f0f630263c565e1f64ed (03:24): hrm. I vote both.
5413d900581bd6546043f95aae132a3f (03:24): I would do both, although i've heard reports of it working without
8f9327ec6dbef67f00539896dd59f167 (03:26): I would think both also but I am not sure.  My boss and I tried on a stack of 3750's today and the send stack came up in rmon mode.
8f9327ec6dbef67f00539896dd59f167 (03:27): We got pulled off that project because of other problems so I thought I would get some opinions tonight.
8f9327ec6dbef67f00539896dd59f167 (03:27): It was starnge to see the 2nd stack member in rmon mode though
8f9327ec6dbef67f00539896dd59f167 (03:30): What do you think nemith?
b28f268a6e12f0f630263c565e1f64ed (03:31): what I need to figure out is how to seamless upgrade a 7500 when rpr is unavailable. pitb.
b28f268a6e12f0f630263c565e1f64ed (03:31): seamlessly*

I do not remember if you have to change the regestery in rmon mode or if you have to rename the startup config and reload the switch only to copy the start back to run after the switch has booted.

8f9327ec6dbef67f00539896dd59f167 (03:39): :/ I opened every link accept that one.  Thanks Catfive.
b28f268a6e12f0f630263c565e1f64ed (03:39): what I hate is that there are like 34 different password recovery mechanisms.
83e887cc6c7cbae584f188af23bbea00 (03:46): in a "sh ip route", what does the left colum mean?  i see S and C
cc9aab29ebea79d6850e644dfe75f241 (03:47): that is the type of route, and not coincidentally a complete key precedes the table output.
b28f268a6e12f0f630263c565e1f64ed (03:47): Static, Connected. there is a legend at the top
83e887cc6c7cbae584f188af23bbea00 (03:51): tmbg, i'm not sure i understand the difference
5413d900581bd6546043f95aae132a3f (03:57): show run | i ip route
